summary: This is an email chain between defense attorney Christian Everdell and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's response to a government letter about the self-authentication of birth certificates for alleged minor victims. The defense submits the response under temporary seal for government redaction review.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, submitting her response to the court regarding birth certificate authentication.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Maxwell's defense legal team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Maxwell's defense legal team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose legal team is submitting a response regarding victim birth certificates.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Recipient of the formal submission letter, addressed as 'Nathan NYSD Chambers', likely a member of Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers staff.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting a legal response on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are copied on defense team correspondence regarding the Maxwell case.

events.title: Government Letter Regarding Birth Certificates
events.description: The government sent a letter concerning the self-authentication of birth certificates for the alleged minor victims in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Defense Submission of Response
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submits their response to the government's letter about victim birth certificates to the court under temporary seal.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: The document is part of the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The subject involves a procedural matter regarding the authentication of birth certificates for alleged minor victims.
The defense protocol involves submitting responses under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorneys Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger.
The correspondence is dated November 20-21, 2021, during Maxwell's trial preparation phase.
